text: The 2010 IIHF World Women's U18 Championship Division I tournament was held in Piešťany, Slovakia, from 3 to 9 April 2010.Division I Statistics Switzerland won the tournament and after a year they returned to the top division. ==Final standings== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" |- !width=165|Team !width=40|GP !width=40|W !width=40|OTW !width=40|OTL !width=40|L !width=40|GF !width=40|GA !width=40|PTS |- style="background:#ccffcc;" |style="text- align:left;"| |5||5||0||0||0||44|| 5||15 |- |style="text-align:left;"| |5||4||0||0||1||16||15||12 |- |style="text-align:left;"| |5||3||0||0||2||17|| 9||9 |- |style="text-align:left;"| |5||2||0||0||3||16||14||6 |- |style="text- align:left;"| |5||1||0||0||4||14||27||3 |- |style="text-align:left;"| |5||0||0||0||5|| 9||46||0 |} is promoted to the Top Division of the 2011 IIHF World Women's U18 Championship ==Results== ==References== Category:IIHF World Women's U18 Championship – Division I World World Category:International ice hockey competitions hosted by Slovakia Category:2009–10 in Slovak ice hockey
title: 2010 IIHF World Women's U18 Championship – Division I
